name: Romaninsh.github.com
body:
### Welcome to @Romaninsh Homepage
![thumb](https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/a44a183ce31ad4fff79b221598c42ae4?s=420&d=https://a248.e.akamai.net/assets.github.com%2Fimages%2Fgravatars%2Fgravatar-user-420.png)

http://vizualize.me/romaninsh

Since 1996 I'm Web Software Developer, Software Architect, Entrepreneur, Investor, Project Manager, System Administrator, Start-up advisor. I specialize in User Interfaces, PHP web frameworks and Software Development Efficiency and Security.

I believe: when using the right framework, object-oriented approach, code refactoring and agile methodologies - you can develop your "Software as a Service" within 3 months with a team of 3 professionals. Our team: @romaninsh, @mayack, @jancha. Our sites: http://elexutech.com http://mayack.com http://agiletech.ie http://ambienttech.lv 



### My Open-source Projects
* Lead Author: [Agile Toolkit - PHP Framework with jQuery](http://agiletoolkit.org/) [Github](http://github.com/atk4/atk4/)
* Author, Coordinator: [Agile Toolkit standard add-ons](http://agiletoolkit.org/develop/addons/) [Github](http://github.com/atk4/atk4-addons/)
* Author: [Lost and Found](https://github.com/romaninsh/lostandfound) - Join our collaborative development hang-out every Wednesday on [Google Plus](https://plus.google.com/114540818849522598220/posts)
* Author: [Jobeet](https://github.com/romaninsh/jobeet) - Comparable implementation to Symphony Jobeet using Agile Toolkit
* Contributor: [Ambient Add-ons](https://github.com/atk4/ambient-addons) - Three amazing add-ons for Agile Toolkit: CMS, Forum and Transactional System
* Contributor: [Joomla integration with Agile Toolkit](https://github.com/atk4/atk4-joomla) - Write your next Joomla component using Agile Toolkit UI. Author: @xavocinternational
* Lead Author: [Agile Toolkit Codepad](http://agiletoolkit.org/codepad) [Github](http://github.com/atk4/atk4-codepad/) - The new best way to share Agile Toolkit code examples
* Lead Author: [DVD Rental](http://github.com/atk4/dvdrental/) - Sample application for DVDRental management developed with Agile Toolkit
* Lead Author: [Membership Site](http://github.com/atk4/member/) - Implementation of a membership website using Agile Toolkit. 
* Lead Author: [Agile Toolkit Unit Tests](http://github.com/atk4/atk4-testsuite/) - Automated tests for Agile Toolkit core, ORM, Active Record and MVC.









This automatic page generator is the easiest way to create beautiful pages for all of your projects. Author your page content here using GitHub Flavored Markdown, select a template crafted by a designer, and publish. After your page is generated, you can check out the new branch:

```
$ cd your_repo_root/repo_name
$ git fetch origin
$ git checkout gh-pages
```

If you're using the GitHub for Mac, simply sync your repository and you'll see the new branch.

### Designer Templates
We've crafted some handsome templates for you to use. Go ahead and continue to layouts to browse through them. You can easily go back to edit your page before publishing. After publishing your page, you can revisit the page generator and switch to another theme. Your Page content will be preserved if it remained markdown format.

### Rather Drive Stick?
If you prefer to not use the automatic generator, push a branch named `gh-pages` to your repository to create a page manually. In addition to supporting regular HTML content, GitHub Pages support Jekyll, a simple, blog aware static site generator written by our own Tom Preston-Werner. Jekyll makes it easy to create site-wide headers and footers without having to copy them across every page. It also offers intelligent blog support and other advanced templating features.

### Authors and Contributors
You can @mention a GitHub username to generate a link to their profile. The resulting `<a>` element will link to the contributor's GitHub Profile. For example: In 2007, Chris Wanstrath (@defunkt), PJ Hyett (@pjhyett), and Tom Preston-Werner (@mojombo) founded GitHub.

### Support or Contact
Having trouble with Pages? Check out the documentation at http://help.github.com/pages or contact support@github.com and weâ€™ll help you sort it out.
